items.sentence: Tom bought a new dishwasher and told Mary that it was her Valentine's Day gift.
It doesn't matter whether the cat is black or white as long as it catches mice.
I've asked Tom several times to sell me that vacant lot he owns on Park Street.
Many people buy lottery tickets with the dream of immediately becoming wealthy.
My older brother and I live in Boston, and my younger brother lives in Chicago.
The union is prepared to outlay their entire strike fund in these negotiations.
Just because you've never heard that word before doesn't mean it doesn't exist.
If you'd spent just a little more money, you could've bought a much better one.
Tom was horrified when he noticed that his daughter had had her tongue pierced.
Tom doesn't like cocktail parties because he finds making small talk difficult.
